page.title: 08Things Past
page.content: Mr Wykes remembers a brickyard at the bottom of Gold Street and the village blacksmith. He recalls that there was a saw mill in Vicarage Lane and a flax mill in Gold Street. Towards Farndish there were some sand- pits and on Wymington Road a lime kiln. There was everything needed for building houses. Stones for building were obtained from the stone pits. Lace making here goes back about 200 years. There was once a lace school. Now younger people are beginning to take an interest in the craft. There was also a boot and shoe industry in the village. A doctor held a weekly surgery in the village and a trained nurse had a cottage in the village. Alas these crafts, industries and services have now disappeared.
